availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: St. Louis, St. Louis County, Missouri

body.p:
State of Missouri
City & County of St Louis } SS.

I, Joseph Lathrop, a resident of the city of St Louis, having been appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky a Commissioner to take the acknowledgment and proof of the execution of deeds and other instruments in writing under Seal to be used and recorded in said State of Kentucky and to administer oaths and affirmations. Do solemnly Swear that I will well and faithfully execute and perform the duties of such commission under and by virtue of the Laws of the said State of Kentucky.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 22d day of December A.D. 1864
Witness my hand and the seal of the St. Louis County Court at St. Louis. Missouri

Comr of Deeds
Jos Lathrop
Missouri
Oath of Office
filed 27th Dec/64
